template.name: CB

transition.label: i : int[0,NT-1], j : int[0,NSEG-1], k : int[0,NSEG-1]
lockedBy == -1

query.formula: A[] forall(i:CB_id) (not(CB(i).Initial) && not(CB(i).Switching) && switches[i] != -1) imply (Point(switches[i]).Plus && CB(i).connected == CBs[i][1]) || (Point(switches[i]).Minus && CB(i).connected == CBs[i][2])
query.comment: The local state information about connected segments of a switch box is consistent with the actual state of the switch.

query.formula: A[] forall(i:t_id) (TCC(i).CrossingPoint imply (CB(TCC(i).nextSB).connected == TCC(i).curSeg && CB(TCC(i).nextSB).stem == TCC(i).nextSeg) || (CB(TCC(i).nextSB).stem == TCC(i).curSeg && CB(TCC(i).nextSB).connected == TCC(i).nextSeg))
query.comment: A train can only cross a point if the point's position is consistent with the segment that the trains is entering.

query.formula: A[] forall(i:t_id) (TCC(i).CrossingPoint imply switches[TCC(i).nextSB] == -1 || Point(switches[TCC(i).nextSB]).Plus || Point(switches[TCC(i).nextSB]).Minus)

A[] forall(i:t_id) (not(TCC(i).Initial) imply (CBs[TCC(i).nextSB][0] == TCC(i).curSeg imply (CBs[TCC(i).nextSB][1] == TCC(i).nextSeg || CBs[TCC(i).nextSB][2] == TCC(i).nextSeg)) && (CBs[TCC(i).nextSB][0] == TCC(i).nextSeg imply (CBs[TCC(i).nextSB][1] == TCC(i).curSeg || CBs[TCC(i).nextSB][2] == TCC(i).curSeg)))
query.comment: A train's current segment is either the same as its next segment or connected to it.
All trains will eventually arrive at their destinations.

query.formula: A[] forall(i:t_id) forall(j:t_id) i != j and not(TCC(i).Initial) and not(TCC(j).Initial) imply TCC(i).curSeg != TCC(j).curSeg
query.comment: Two trains are never on the same segment after the initialization step.

query.formula: A[] forall(id:t_id) forall(i:Seg_id) TCC(id).Initial or (TCC(id).boxes[i] == controlBoxes[id][i] and not(TCC(id).Initial))
query.comment: A trains internal notion of the control boxes will always be the same as its global counterpart after it has left the initial state

query.formula: A[] forall(id:t_id) forall(i:Seg_id) TCC(id).Initial or (TCC(id).route[i] == routes[id][i] and not(TCC(id).Initial))
query.comment: A trains internal notion of its route will always be the same as its global counterpart after it has left the initial state
